messages.subject: [NHEN-SpeakOut] Homeschooling in the News 4/18/01
messages.msgSnippet: April 16 News-Herald : Students need two semesters for public diploma http://www.zwire.com/site/news.cfm?newsid=1681341&BRD=1698&PAG=461&dept_id=218 49&rfi=6
messages.messageBody:
April 16
News-Herald : Students need two semesters for public diploma
http://www.zwire.com/site/news.cfm?newsid=1681341&BRD=1698&PAG=461&dept_id=218

49&rfi=6
Ohio high schools are implementing a policy to require two semesters of
attendance before a previously homeschooled, charter schooled, or cyber
schooled student may earn a diploma.

Apri 14
Charleston Daily Mail : Senate changes home-school measure
http://www.dailymail.com/news/News/2001041426/
WV Senate adds tighter regulations to a bill originally intended to ease
homeschooling requirements.

Dominion Post : Home school bill now in committee
http://www.dominionpost.com/a/news/2001/04/14/ac/
More on the WV legislation.

Charleston Gazette : Capitol action Friday
http://www.wvgazette.com/news/Other+News/2001041415/
Another summary of the WV legislation.

Honolulu Advertiser : Kane'ohe parents form 'home school'
http://the.honoluluadvertiser.com/article/2001/Apr/14/ln/ln03a.html
Parents form a cooperative homeschool during a teacher strike.

April 8
Sunday Times : Emerging into the bright light of outside world
http://www.sunday-times.co.uk/news/pages/sti/2001/04/08/stiednedn01001.html
A UK parent's 'diary' of thoughts on homeschooling and their daughter's
socialization.

Minor mentions:

April 17
Post-Tribune : Pittman won't reopen April 23
http://www.post-trib.com/news/story9.html

Star-Telegram : 17 area high school seniors earn corporate National Merit
awards
http://www.star-telegram.com:80/news/doc/1047/1:METRO36/1:METRO360417101.html

April 16
Clarion-Ledger : Team hoping to score math win
http://www.clarionledger.com/news/0104/16/z2.html

Roswell Daily Record : KcKelvy takes interest in children, medical research
http://www.roswell-record.com/archives/041601/news03.html

Las Vegas Review-Journal : Republicans crossed lines to help dedicate Miller
school
http://www.lvrj.com/lvrj_home/2001/Apr-16-Mon-2001/news/15813625.html

April 15
Daily Telegraph : State capitol buzzes with activity
http://www.zwire.com/site/news.cfm?newsid=1676819&BRD=2088&PAG=461&dep
t_id=346229&rfi=6


Laura Derrick
National Home Education Network
http://www.nhen.org
